1.featuretext:
MAGICAL ARTS
At 1st level you have learned martial arts alongside
spellcasting, so you have discovered how to better defend
yourself while casting your spells. While you aren't wearing
armor or wielding a shield, you gain the following bencfits:
You can use a bonus action on your turn to take the Dodge
action immediately before or after you cast a spell of 1st
level or higher
• You can replace the material components (those without a
cost) of a spell with a somatic component represented by
an appropriate martial arts technique instead (casting
times longer than an action or bonus action would be
represented by long martial arts demonstrations
throughout the casting time).

SOUL FIST TECHNIQUE
Starting at 1st level your practice of martial arts gives you
better control over the untamed magic raging inside you.
With that newfound control you have learned how to meld
your magical power into your marital arts to practice a new
fighting style known as the soul fist technique. While you
aren't wearing armor or wielding a shield you gain the
following benefits:
You can use your action to attack with an enhanced punch
or kick powered by your magical energy (this is a unique
action and not a new option for the attack action. The
soul strike is a melee spell attack with a range of 5 feet.
You are proficient with it, and you add your Charisma
modifier to the attack and damage rolls. Its damage is
bludgeoning, and its damage die is a d&
This dic changes as you gain Sorcerer levels. The
damage of the soul strike changes to 2d8 at level 5 to 3d8
at level 11, and to 4d8 at level 17
. If you make a soul strike on your turn, you gain a +2 bonus
to AC until the start of your next turn, while you aren't
incapacitated
• When a hostile creature's movement provokes an
opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to
make 1 soul strike on that creature, rather than making an
opportunity attack

6.featuretext:
DISCIPLE OF METAMAGICS
At 6th level, you become inspired by your ability to twist your
spells to suit your needs, so you start personalizing your soul
fist technique. You gain metamagic disciplines based on your
chosen Metamagic options. These metamagic disciplines are
detailed at the end of the subclass description. Different
metamagic disciplines can be used on the same turn with no
restrictions outside how many sorcery points you have left
(For example, you can use both the Careful Spell and
Heightened Spell disciplines on the same soul strike so long
you meet the requirements for cach of them). You can't cast
spells other than cantrips the turn you use a metamagic
discipline

METAMAGIC DISCIPLINES
The Disciple of Metamagics feture lets you learn disciplines if
you have the corresponding Metamagic options.

Careful Spell When you target a hostile creature with
your soul strike, you can spend 1 sorcery point to gain the
benefit of the Disengage action. When you reach 14th level of
Sorccrcr, your walking speed incrcascs by 10 feet until the
end of the current turn as well

Distant Spell. When you make a soul strike on your tum,
you can spend 1 sorcery point to make your reach for it is 5
fect grcater than normal When you reach 14th level of
Sorcerer, your reach for the soul strike on your turn is 25 fect

Empowered Spell. When you hit a target with your soul
strike, you can spend sorcery points (5 max) to add 1d6 to the
damage roll for each sorcery point spent. When you reach
14th level of Sorcerer, you now add 1d8 to the damage roll

Extended Spell As a bonus action, you can spend 2
sorcery points to spend I Hit Die to heal yourself. Roll the
die, add your Constitution modifier, and regain a number of
hit points equal to the total (minimum of 1) When you reach
14th level of Sorcerer, you gain temporary hit points equal to
double the amount of hit points recovered as well.

Heightened Spell When you hit a creature with your soul
strike, you can spend 3 sorcery points to give the target
disadvantage on their next saving throw until the start of your
next turn.

Quickened Spell You can spend 2 sorcery points to use
your soul strike with a bonus action.

Seeking Spell As a bonus action, you can spend 2 sorcery
points to gain advantage on your next soul strike attack roll
When you reach 14th level of Sorcerer, your next soul strike
ignores half cover and three-quarters cover.

Subtle Spell. As a bonus action, you can spend 1 sorcery
point to gain proficiency in the Acrobatics, Stcalth, and Slight
of Hand skills if you don't already have it until the start of
your next turn. When you reach 14th level of Sorcerer, your
proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make
that uses these proficiencies, but you cannot benefit from a
similar feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your

Transmuted Spell When you hit a target with your soul
strike. you can spend 1 sorcery point to change your soul
strike's damage type from bludgeoning to acid, cold, fire,
lightning, poison, or thunder damage till the end of your next
turn. When you reach 14th level in Sorcerer, your soul strike's
damage type remains changed for 1 minute instead.

Twinned Spell When you use your action to use your soul
strike, you can spend 1 sorcery point to make 2 soul fists
strikes instead of just 1.

14.featuretext:
MASTERY OF BODY AND SOUL
At level 14, you have mastered the soul fist technique. All your
training of your body and soul has now bore fruit, so you gain
the following benefits:
• You gain proficiency in Dexterity or Wisdom saving
throws (your choice)
You suffer none of the frailty of old age, and you cannot be
aged magically. You can still die of old age however,

18.featuretext:
AWAKENING OF ASTRAL POWER
At level 18 you can unlock the subconscious restraints you
placed on your magical power to prevent it from getting out of
control. Now that you have full control over your magic with
no restrictions on them, you can use it to enhance your soul
fist technique's power to reach your full potential
As a bonus action, you can spend 10 sorcery points to gain
the following benefits for 1 minute while you are not
incapacitated:
• You summon three copies of your astral self to appear
alongside you and assist in battle. You gain the effects of a
mirror image spell, but the duplicates can now affect
creatures that relies on senses other than sight, such as
blindsight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with
trucsight.
• You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing
damage from nonmagical weapons.
Your soul strike now has a +3 bonus to attack and damage
rolls.
